page.title: 07The Kylesku Ferries
page.content: July 1984 saw the end of a great attraction at Kylesku, the Kylesku Ferry. For more than 200 years some sort of ferry service had been provided. Till the early 1800s travel was by horse and by foot over the rough tracks made by drovers. At this stage the ferry consisted of a rowing boat; cattle and horses had to swim. In the latter part of the 19th century a six oared cobble with a platform of turf was in use. Later this type was replaced by a cable operated steel barge with a hand winch which took four men to operate. During the two World Wars the ferry reverted to a rowing boat. Various turntable vessels were used until the last ferry, a large roll on roll off ferry, came into operation in 1977.
